page.title: 13Tulip Time.
page.content: Every year, as May comes around the annual tulip time activity gets under way. Spalding boasts a carnival parade, but all the little churches have their own displays. Up goes the green canvas tent beside the church door. Local ladies join the rota to man the stall. There are cakes and teas, little plants in pots, and while the visitors gaze at flower arrangements in the church, the kettle boils again to slake the next ones thirst. Parade day itself, the traffic queues creep by and many a traveller leaves the line for sustenance. Church funds benefit and the vicar beams. People climb the tower and look at flowers in the distance. They go home, happy, for another year. Flowers fade, leaves wither away leaving bulbs for summer harvest.
